body.name: Winsome Halifax Storage/Organization, 5 drawer, Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 15. Order within 18 mins
features: Note : To ensure proper assembly, please follow all steps provided in the User Guide (provided in pdf below)
5 drawers cabinet use as a dresser or just storage cabinet
Removable casters for stationary or mobility

Note : Exterior of the item is black. However, inside of each drawer is white.they are all black and if they just want to assemble the item, they will see the black exterior and inside drawer is white.
body.description: Use the Winsome Wood Halifax 5-Drawer Cabinet to help stay organized. A clean, simple design that you will find function to in just about any room of your home. Eliminate the appearance of clutter in your craft room, kitchen or kids’ room. The Halifax storage carts feature a multitude of drawers with cutout drawer pulls that allow for easy-open access and helps create an easily accessible storage unit. Store paper and other material used for a business in your in-home office or den. Sitting on four casters, two of which lock, allowing for easy mobility when needing to move or locking in place to use as a stationary. With a vertical design that helps to minimize the need for a lot of floor space, making this an ideal unit for a walk-in closet; store your jewelry, styling accessories, makeup pallet and brushes. Easy glide drawers with an interior dimension of 15.9”W x 11.73”D x 2.55”H and a weight capacity of 20lbs each. Finished in black with white drawer interior for easy search and grab of items within. Constructed of a combination of sturdy solid beech wood and some composite. For additional storage, pair with other organizers from the Winsome Halifax collection. Conveniently packed and shipped in 1 box, that includes the hardware necessary for assembling. Replacement part request can be submitted directly to the manufacturer within 60 days from date of purchase.Unit dims: 19.2"W x 15.9"D x 35.3"HDrawer interior dims: 15.9"W x 11.73"D x 2.55"HFloor clearance: 2.1” (If casters are used)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and useful
reviews.reviewText: Although it was quite an involved assembly process, lots of parts and pieces. It was very simple to just repeat the process 5 times for each drawer. Although this is not an IKEA purchase the assembly did borrow from thier ingenuity and the final product is sturdy, the fit and function exceed all expectations. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and Functional
reviews.reviewText: We recently purchased the Winsome 10519 Halifax 5-Drawer Cabinet in white for my teenage daughter’s room, and we couldn’t be happier! Assembly was straightforward, and the cabinet fits beautifully, adding a modern and chic touch to her space.The composite wood material is impressive, providing sturdiness and a smooth finish that resists daily wear and tear. Each drawer slides out effortlessly, offering ample space for her clothes, accessories, and school supplies. The size is just right, not too bulky, yet it provides plenty of storage.What we love most is the cabinet’s sleek white color that brightens her room and matches perfectly with her decor. It’s functional, yet it doubles as a stylish piece of furniture that elevates the overall look of her room.Overall, we are thrilled with this purchase. It’s a high-quality, durable, and stylish storage solution that perfectly meets our needs. I highly recommend the Winsome 5-Drawer Cabinet to anyone looking to organize and enhance their space with elegance. Five stars!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Cabinets For the Price.
reviews.reviewText: I ordered two of these to be the supporters for my new desk. It took me about four hours to put both of them together. So let me go over the experience I had with these cabinets.Quality:It's cheap, pressed wood, covered by paint. The wood chips easily, especially when you're putting in the screws to hold the rails, if it god forbids falls down or any other mishaps. So be extra careful with this.Take as much time as you need to physically secure a screw rather than use power tools. I used power tools too, but I set it on a lower setting like 3-4. Sometimes the tool couldn't force it to go anymore and I had to tighten the screw manually.Building the drawers: The matching of the holes of metal parts and wooden parts about 40%-60% accurate. Meaning - about 40% of he holes will match up with the metal bar properly, 60% will be either too close to the metal bar, so when you screw in your screw it cracks the product, or it will be too far so kind of have it held in place by someone else while you're putting in the screw. Expect a lot of frustration with that part. It's tedious and unpleasant.The grooves on the sides of the drawers, where the bottom part supposed to slide in do not match up in about 40% of the time. Expect several drawers to have to either hit the bottom until you force it to slide ALL the way in or just not caring whether it slides all the way in and pray that the top part, the part with the cut out for the handle, will be able to fit. Either way, again, cheap production don't expect perfection, causes frustration, but much less than the screws.Building the Sides: This part is rather easy. Holes on the sides of the cabinet match to the metal railing pretty nicely, in about 99% of the time. I've had two, I think out of fourteen (I ordered two) that required a bit of nudging to get it secured with both screws, properly.Metal Rails:The rails that allow the drawers to move back and forth are of good quality, however, the rails that you put ON the drawers are not so muchly. They are also metal and for the most part, about 70% are of good quality. There are a few, however, where the wheel will stick, preventing the drawer from moving forward, leaving it about quarter of the way open. It's very, very frustrating because pressing it harder to move in does not do anything. Neither does applying a little more force. You have to press down and left on the drawer to force it to close. After a few attempts I took the drawer out and looked the wheel and it's all banged and cut from the tries of forcing the drawer all the way in. I don't know what's wrong with it, I'll try to use WD40 on it to see if it helps. Majority of the drawers do NOT have this problem.In the end, there's a little bag with four plastic corners. Do NOT forget those or your cabinets will wobble something fierce.Warning: I came upon two pieces that were not what I needed. Because of that ONE of my drawers has an issue, but it can be fixed with glue so I am not too worried. Just don't be surprised if you get a piece that is not what you need.Instructions:Instructions are fairly easy. It's just a picture of a drawer with all the parts that are labeled. I usually am really pretty inept in putting things together, but aside from a few things where I needed assistance in holding stuff down so I can fasten the screws in, the instructions were a breeze. Picture matches clearly to the part in front of you, there's very, very little confusion about what is going on and what is needed to bring the piece together. Maybe they re-done the instructions, I don't know, but I had NO trouble figuring out what needs to be done.Looks:So, when I finally put it all together I must say they look VERY nice. The coating on them is not too shiny, the color is rich and the paint does not scratch easily. Cut outs on the front of the drawers are also super comfortable when you open the drawer, I even prefer it to the handles.Final Thoughts: Despite of its shortcomings in some ways, these cabinets and drawers are a great buy on a budget. They are very sturdy, they look really good and they are cheap. I would recommend this product to anyone who is looking for the most bang for their buck. Also if you treat them gently - aka - won't go around kicking them and scratching them - I will not be surprised if these things last you for years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to make but a little shallow
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I recently purchased the Halifax 5-Drawer Cabinet, and it has proven to be a fantastic addition to my home organization. The assembly process was a breeze, making it a user-friendly experience right from the start.The overall quality of the Halifax cabinet is excellent. The materials used and the attention to detail in the construction reflect a high standard of craftsmanship. It feels sturdy and durable, ensuring that it will stand the test of time.One of the standout features is its suitability for small spaces. The compact design of the cabinet makes it an ideal storage solution for areas where space is limited. It fits seamlessly into my room without overwhelming the surroundings, providing both style and functionality.However, it's important to note that the drawers are not very deep. They are approximately the depth of one stack of printer paper. While this may limit the storage capacity for larger items, it works well for organizing smaller items, keeping them easily accessible and neatly arranged.In conclusion, the Halifax 5-Drawer Cabinet is a top-notch choice for those seeking an easy-to-assemble, high-quality storage solution for small spaces. While the drawers may not be very deep, their design is well-suited for organizing smaller items efficiently. I highly recommend it for anyone looking to enhance their home organization in a stylish and practical way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very high quality
reviews.reviewText: It looks and is very high quality. The drawers slide in and out perfectly. I've had issues to building drawers in the past and these are fool proof. They work and line up perfectly the way drawers should be. I did find them time consuming to build but I'm glad because they work so well.
muy bonito y muy facil de armar

I bought this in March 2021. Putting it together was lengthy but very doable. Most important is the finished product! The look is sleek and lovely. The drawers slide so easily and smoothly still. I would definitely buy this again. I had bought another that was supposed to be like this recently and it is not even close! Not as smooth and not even the size as advertised. I will be sticking with this brand.
Este producto llegó a tiempo, fue fácil de montar y es de buena calidad. Me encanta para guardar mis materiales de arte.
Fácil de armar y resistente las ruedas deslizan suavemente

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it but hard to assemble
reviews.reviewText: This was not easy to put together took way to long instructions not so easy as its not a step by step its just pictures. Had issues withthe drawers not fitting right so had to get help with it....BUT after all said and done I do love it. I use mine for my makeup and hair stuff fits my blowdryer brushs and curling irons and more. I got organizers for it and they fit well. Its sturdy and easy to move around on the wheels. :)
